poem:
### The Wasted Moment

In the quiet pause of morning,  
amidst discarded paper cups,  
a symphony of unsung notes lingers.  
We stroll past possibility,  
tread light in comfortable routines,  
while fields of dreams remain unharvested.  
Awake, you dusty architects of change,  
before your blueprints fade into silence—  
let the world marvel at your intricate designs.
